Tuckahoe Plantation

mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The plantation was established by William Randolph of Turkey Island for his sons. His second son, Thomas, probably built the north wing by 1723. The south wing, connecting saloon, and carved woodwork were most likely added by Thomas' son, William Randolph, after his marriage in 1734 to Maria Judith Page of Rosewell. (Source: Virginia Landmarks Register, 1999, p. 196) [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
